titleInfo.title: James A. Rogers in St. Louis to Hon. W. G. Brownlow

mods.note: Letter from James A. Rogers in St. Louis on the letterhead of the "Olive Street Hotel, St. Louis, Mo." Introduces the Governor Yabulan C. Nolen and recommends him, as a Unionist and Old Whig, for a government appointment. Also Rogers himself would like a judgeship and asks Brownlow to influence President Johnson to so appoint him.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
